title: Carcass of pregnant leopard found in outskirts of Bengaluru
content: Following the incident Yeshwanthpur MLA S.T. Somasekar has alleged that illegal mining has been taking place in the area for some time and the leopard‚Äôs death was due to blasting at one of the quarries

title: Kerala government kicks off Navakeralam Citizens Response Programme
content: Navakeralam Citizens Response Programme is a State government initiative to collect feedback from the public to plan future development ahead of 2026 Assembly elections

title: Truck driver burnt alive after collision amid dense fog on UP highway
content: ‚ÄúA truck carrying gypsum from Ahlanabad in Haryana to Varanasi rammed into another truck ahead of it after the latter suddenly applied brakes amid poor visibility due to dense fog,‚Äù says Police

title: Five houses gutted, two injured in fire in J&K's Kishtwar
content: Two persons engaged in firefighting efforts suffered injuries and were given first aid, officials said

title: Eight U.S. lawmakers pen letter in support of Umar Khalid; urge India to grant bail, fair trial ‚Äòas per international law‚Äô
content: This follows another separate letter from newly sworn in Mayor of New York City Zohran Mamdani, who penned a note remembering the jailed activist

title: Out in the cold: Data reveals dearth of homeless shelters in Bengaluru
content: While Bengaluru City Police data reveals that the city has witnessed the deaths of more than 15 homeless people over the last 40 days, there are only 48 shelters when Bengaluru should have at least 120, writes Chetan B.C.

title: In Telangana, illicit narcotics business behind an ordinary facade
content: From a school building in Bowenpally to a chemical unit in Cherlapalli, narcotics operations functioned undisturbed for months and years in different parts of Hyderabad, shielded by familiarity and public trust. This strategy of hiding in plain sight, according to investigators, blunts suspicion, delays intelligence gathering and allows criminal economies to expand quietly.¬†Naveen Kumar¬†delves into the networks, methods and audacity of these hidden hubs

title: In Haryana, provocative pop picks guns and goons
content: In Haryana, folk music has given way to Haryanvi pop over the past decade, marking a generational shift and taking the local music industry to international platforms. Part of this trend are themes of guns, gangs, and hooliganism, with many such songs garnering millions of views, leading to police complaints and ban orders by courts, finds Ashok Kumar

title: How Animal Aid Association in Madras became Blue Cross of India
content:
In 1959, Captain V. Sundaram brought home two stranded puppies he found on a flooded street¬†near his house at T. Nagar.
He built makeshift kennels at home for injured and abandoned animals. This organisation was registered as the¬†BCI¬†in 1964

title: An idol found near¬†Gangaikonda¬† Cholapuram¬†confirms the ‚ÄòThiruvarasu‚Äô of¬†Nathamunigal
content: Near the¬†Gangaikonda¬†Cholapuram-Kumbakonam¬†Road is a place called¬†Sorgapallam¬†or¬†Sembodai¬†where an idol of¬†Srinivasa¬† Perumal¬† as once found¬†half-buried under a tree. In the year 2000, another idol was found buried in a field. It was that of the first of the Sri Vaishnava Acharyas, who was said to have been at the place in his final hours

title: Tamil Nadu‚Äôs link to a key amendment to the Constitution on freedom of press, expression
content: On March 1, 1950, the Madras government banned Cross Roads, a Left-leaning journal. A month later, the Supreme Court‚Äôs full Bench, by five to one, quashed the order. The Constitution had to be amended in the light of the landmark judgment. Parliament adopted the amendment Bill, with 246 members voting in favour and 14 against

title: Vehicle registrations rose by 8.4% in 2025 in Tamil Nadu
content: More than 40% of the total registrations were concentrated in Chennai, Chengalpattu, Tiruvallur, Coimbatore, Madurai, and Salem districts; a total of 21.18 lakh vehicles were registered last year

title: Owaisi advocates enhanced education access and standards in Telangana
content: I would like to be known for my work in the education field rather than my political speeches, says AIMIM MLA Akbaruddin Owaisi

title: State records 5.78% growth in net GST collections in December 2025
content: At ‚Çπ2,652 crore, the collections are the highest-ever for the month of December since the GST regime began in 2017, says official

title: Approached HC 104 times to hold rallies in West Bengal: BJP leader
content: Suvendu Adhikari said that interventions by the Calcutta High Court were necessary because the police routinely denied permission ‚Äòpurely to stifle opposition voices and crush democratic rights‚Äô

title: ED searches seven locations in Rajasthan in Digi Mudra scam case
content: The ED initiated investigation based on the first information reports registered by the Special Task Force, Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh, and other police stations in various districts of Rajasthan, Haryana, Odisha and Maharashtra

title: ED attaches ‚Çπ33.66-crore assets in Birla Emporium-Ira Finance case
content: The ED probe is based on a First Information Report registered by the police in Manipur,  against Yumnam Irabanta Singh, director of Birla Emporium and Ira Finance

title: Nadia bomb blast victim Tamanna‚Äôs mother hospitalised¬†in Kolkata after condition deteriorates
content: Opposition blames government and police for the situation; Trinamool says police taking necessary action

title: Police act against 130 locals for possessing VPNs on mobile phones in Kashmir
content: ‚ÄúGenuine users were released after detailed device analysis with a strict warning to refrain from VPN usage in the future,‚Äù the police said

title: Arunachal celebrates India‚Äôs first sunrise of 2026 with ‚ÄòDance of the Dawn‚Äô
content: The performance was an artistic narrative through chants, songs, and indigenous rhythms of the Meyor and Mishmi communities, combined with contemporary dance and poetry

title: Oppose land distribution to workers, lose incentives: Assam CM to tea planters
content: The State government brought legislation to guarantee ‚Äúland protection‚Äù for 3.33 lakh tea plantation worker families across 825 estates

title: Kashmir cricketer sports Palestinian flag during match, comes under Jammu police scanner
content: Several players privy to the development said a cricketer, identified as Furqan Bhat, wore a helmet with a Palestinian flag on it

title: T.N. govt. revises rules on using funds for people hit by mining operations
content: The rules specify that a minimum of 70% of the District Mineral Trust Fund¬†must be spent only on directly affected areas, and¬†for high-priority sectors such as drinking water supply and health care

title: Let food be thy medicine: on nutrition as component of healing in oncology
content: Wholesome, nutrient-rich food can both protect from non-communicable diseases such as cancer and also serve as a pillar for recovery from cancer

title: Most Bihar Cabinet Ministers are wealthier than CM Nitish Kumar
content: Mr. Kumar‚Äôs assets are worth ‚Çπ1.66 crore, up ‚Çπ68,455 from last year; his Deputy CMs Samrat Choudhary and V.K. Sinha are significantly wealthier, with assets valued at ‚Çπ6.38 crore and ‚Çπ8.81 crore respectively

title: Post-festive rush chokes Bengaluru‚ÄìMysuru highway, Tumakuru Road, NICE Road
content: Commuters attribute the congestion to the simultaneous return of holidaymakers after an extended break

title: CM challenges KCR to discuss water projects in Assembly
content: Alleges lure of ‚Äúcommissions‚Äù responsible for PRLIS project cost rising from ‚Çπ32,000 crore to ‚Çπ84,000 crore; Mr. Revanth Reddy says government will inquire into the issue

title: 26 Indore water samples found contaminated
content: Official death toll at four, but residents say 14 people have died; 2,500 sick, 100 hospitalised; NHRC issues notice to M.P. Chief Secy; entire supply line cleaned, leakages repaired, water replaced, says Indore DC

title: From encroachment to legal ownership
content: Haryana government regularises unauthorised occupation of village panchayat land through payment, aiming to reduce litigation and resolve disputes; this risks converting encroachment into ownership, stabilising gains for those with ability to pay while limiting access for marginalised households on village commons

title: How a viral video led Maharashtra Police to a kidney transplant racket
content: Maharashtra investigators allege illegal network¬†involving two doctors with links to Cambodia; they say poor youth and marginalised farmers from the State sold kidneys for ‚Çπ5 lakh to ‚Çπ8 lakh

title: Officers to visit vulnerable groups for SIR hearings: Bengal CEO
content: Representatives of vulnerable communities had appealed to the Chief Electoral Officer to protect eligible electors unable to find their lineage in the 2002 voter list or provide required documents on account of their marginalised position

title: CITU conference condemns VB-G RAM G, SHANTI Acts, Labour Codes
content: VB-G RAM G Act has overturned statutory rights, alongwith imposing financial and administrative burden on the State governments, undermining the federal structure of the Constitution: CITU general secretary

title: Ensure Bengaluru does not become a gas chamber like Delhi, Khandre tells officials
content: Khandre says, ‚ÄòWhen I recently went to Delhi, it was difficult to breathe in the smog-filled atmosphere. The officials should be committed to protecting Bengaluru and strictly follow all the laws framed by the State and the Central governments for environmental protection.‚Äô

title: One killed as banner row triggers clash, firing near Janardhan Reddy‚Äôs residence in Ballari
content: Gunmen linked to Satish Reddy opened four or five rounds of fire, the former Minister says while displaying bullets used in the firing

title: NHAI to rope in new contractor to resume work on ‚Çπ22-crore vehicular underpass near Arcot town
content: This comes after the multi-crore project was abandoned by an earlier contractor due to lack of funds. Due to this, the police had allowed traffic on the incomplete elevated corridor above the underpass to decongest the narrow service lane leading to Vellore Town

title: Bound by Constitution, Kerala couple tie the knot
content: Instead of traditional rituals, the couple, Sheetal and Jithin, exchanged copies of the Indian Constitution at their wedding

title: After months of silence, tourists flock to Kashmir to ring in the New Year
content: It is for the first time since the Pahalgam terror attack, which left 26 tourists dead in April last year, that the Kashmir valley recorded a bustling¬†tourist season

title: CM defends car trip with Vellappally Natesan, but refutes his remarks on CPI
content: Pinarayi Vijayan is not Binoy Viswam, says Chief Minister on the CPI leader‚Äôs comment that he would not have allowed Vellappally to travel in his car. CM, however, underscores the warm relations the CPI(M) has with the CPI

title: Kogilu demolition: Alternative housing for eligible families to be distributed on Jan. 2
content: Meanwhile, residents whose houses were demolished¬†in¬†Fakeer Colony and Waseem Layout¬†staged protests on¬†Thursday, alleging that the government had not clearly defined the eligibility criteria for allotment of alternative housing

title: Don‚Äôt need treaty with Dhaka to push back ‚Äòillegal immigrants‚Äô, says Himanta
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma is confident of a BJP victory in the 2026 Assembly election; he says the government plans to deport 10,000 to 15,000 foreigners every year

title: Why are government school teachers protesting in Tamil Nadu?
content: Tamil Nadu government school teachers protest for equal pay, demanding resolution of longstanding pay disparities

title: Sabarimala gold theft case: Pinarayi denies interference by his office in SIT probe
content: Chief Minister says it is common knowledge that SIT probe is monitored by High Court, ruling out need for a  CBI probe at this stage, adding that UDF convener‚Äôs allegation against CMO meant to divert attention from the real issue ‚Äî as to how the prime accused in the case gained access to a high-profile leader such as Sonia Gandhi

title: Liquor worth  ‚Çπ1,669 crore sold in the last week of December
content: Despite slump in sales of IML, excise revenue collection increases; government sets an excise revenue target at ‚Çπ40,000 crore for 2025-2026 financial year

title: Two new districts, Polavaram and Markapuram, come into force
content: The move, effective from December 31, 2025, aims to streamline governance, improve service delivery, and address regional development needs more effectively

title: Financial dominance over wife cannot qualify as ‚Äòcruelty‚Äô, Supreme Court judgment
content: Criminal litigation cannot become a gateway or a tool to settle scores and pursue personal vendettas, says the Apex Court.

title: In a blooper, Kerala BJP mouthpiece carries Muslim League organ‚Äôs edit page on New Year‚Äôs day
content: In a technical mix-up during the printing process, the Kannur-Kasaragod edition of Janmabhumi carried the editorial page of Chandrika daily, which had an article by IUML State president Syed Sadikali Shihab Thangal. The rare blooper, though jarring for Janmabhumi readers, helped Chandrika ‚Äòconnect with a different section of readers‚Äô

title: Charity donations replace New Year gifts at Sri Sathya Sai Collectorate
content: Novel initiative helps gather donations worth ‚Çπ2.62 lakh, including medical kits for TB patients, competitive examination books and blankets

title: Full fleet of 21 new six-coach trains to be deployed on Green Line, easing congestion on Purple Line
content: Namma Metro officials say that the plan involves shifting existing Phase-1 train sets currently operating on the Green Line to the 43-km Purple Line corridor between Whitefield and Challaghatta

title: 1,500 e-buses will be inducted into APSRTC fleet soon, says Dwaraka Tirumala Rao
content: In the new year, focus will be on improving passenger convenience and modernisation of bus stations and depots, says the RTC Managing Director

title: Golding, Ole Miss edge Georgia, will meet Miami
content: With a field goal and a safety in the final minute of the fourth quarter, Ole Miss defeated Georgia 39-34 in the Sugar Bowl to advance to the College Football Playoff semifinals against Miami.

title: IU tops Tide in 'dream come true'; Ducks up next
content: Indiana quarterback Fernando Mendoza and the top-seeded Hoosiers won the Rose Bowl Thursday in convincing fashion, authoring a 38-3 victory over No. 9 Alabama to secure a berth in the College Football Playoff semifinals, where they will meet No. 5 Oregon.

title: DeBoer: 'Fine line' between Alabama, greatness
content: Alabama Crimson Tide coach Kalen DeBoer said there is "a fine line" between his team's historic 38-3 loss to Indiana in the College Football Playoff quarterfinal at the Rose Bowl and where it wants to be.

title: Ducks' defense blanks Tech to reach CFP semis
content: Matayo Uiagalelei caused a fumble to set up a touchdown as the Ducks silenced Texas Tech 23-0 in the Orange Bowl to reach the College Football Playoff semifinals.

title: Kiffin skips Sugar, attends LSU women's hoops
content: New LSU football coach Lane Kiffin attended the Tigers' women's basketball game as his former team, Ole Miss, was taking on Georgia in the College Football Playoff quarterfinal.

title: Sources: Aikman to advise Fins on GM search
content: The Dolphins have brought on Hall of Fame quarterback and ESPN analyst Troy Aikman as a consultant to advise the organization on its general manager search process, according to sources.

title: Lamar: I'm playing, have never quit on Ravens
content: Lamar Jackson says he's expecting to play when the Ravens take on the Steelers in Pittsburgh for the AFC North title Sunday night.

title: Venus gets wild-card invite to play Australian Open
content: Seven-time Grand Slam singles champion Venus Williams received a wild-card entry for the Australian Open beginning Jan. 18 in Melbourne.

title: üèà Barnwell names his annual All-Pro team
content: Jaxon Smith-Njigba and Puka Nacua were clear WR picks, but the CB group was hard to sort out. Which 50 players made Bill Barnwell's list?

content: How each team can win its semifinal game, plus key players and what we learned from the quarterfinals.

content: For years, this feud has become must-watch TV, and Sunday won't be any different in a "winner-takes-all" game.

content: We found fatal flaws for all 12 clinched teams in the playoff field, plus the AFC North and NFC South teams trying to join them entering Week 18.

content: As each team is ousted from the College Football Playoff, we look at its offseason storylines and personnel priorities.

title: Why Pilates is more than a New Year's resolution for some of the NFL's best
content: Stefon Diggs, Nik Bonitto, Will Anderson and more players are utilizing Pilates to activate core muscles.

content: Which teams will make coaching changes? Could Jeff Hafley or Chris Shula land an open job? Here's our coach movement intel ahead of Week 18.

content: The former pro signed with Baylor midseason. How did it happen, and what does this mean for the sport?

title: Women: Are the top seeds already decided?
content: March is months away, but UConn, Texas, South Carolina, UCLA and LSU look locked in on the top two seed lines.

title: Men: Vanderbilt is exceeding expectations as a projected 2-seed
content: The unbeaten 'Dores weren't expected to be this good this season, but we could very well see history made in March.

title: Our favorite games of 2025: World Series Game 7, four-homer performances and much more
content: From playoff thrillers to epic individual achievements, see the moments we'll remember for decades to come.

title: New year, same problems for a Liverpool side lacking depth, dynamism
content: Devoid of the swagger that marked last season's title run, Liverpool's draw with Leeds showed how much work remains for Arne Slot.

title: Sunderland's draw against Man City reinforces unpredictability
content: The second half of the Premier League season is open to anyone who might strive for their objectives.

title: Don't expect Chelsea to hire an elite coach after Maresca split
content: Chelsea used to demand success, hiring the world's best coaches to deliver results. Enzo Maresca's departure reveals that that's no longer the case.

title: Messi will score his 900th career goal in 2026. Can he reach 1,000? Can he pass Ronaldo?
content: Lionel Messi is never far from his next record or landmark, and he enters 2026 on the verge of yet another massive milestone: his 900th goal.

title: Caitlin Clark talks new shoe, football on Kelces' 'New Heights' podcast
content: The Indiana Fever guard discussed the process of creating her signature shoe, which will debut this spring, among other topics.

title: The NHL is back at the Olympics! Everything you need to know about hockey in Milan Cortina
content: Many of the world's best hockey players will face off in Italy. What's the format? Who are the favorites and top players?

title: The storylines that will define F1 as it enters a new era in 2026
content: To celebrate the start of a new year, we bid adieu to 2025 and F1's ground-effect era and welcome new rules that will dominate the headlines in 2026.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Manchester United eye move for Mateta
content: Manchester United are keen on signing Crystal Palace striker Jean-Philippe Mateta. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Seven questions Liverpool must answer in January
content: The January transfer window is open, and top clubs like Liverpool have big and expensive decisions to make.

title: The Playbook: Shadow Reports, lineup locks and projected scores for Week 18
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: DraftKings DFS cheat sheet: Best values for Sunday's main slate
content: Identifying players to spend up for, teams to stack, value picks to grab and players you need to avoid.

title: "I Think Of Your Words": Umar Khalid's Partner Shares Mamdani's Letter To Him
content: Zohran Mamdani, the new mayor of New York City, has written a letter to former Jawaharlal Nehru University student and activist Umar Khalid.

title: Friends' Vrindavan Trip On New Year Ends In Car Crash In Faridabad, 1 Dead
content: A Baleno car carrying five friends overturned in Faridabad after a tyre suddenly burst, causing the driver to lose control. The crash left one person dead and four others injured.

title: Ex-Air Force Officer Asks Sons To Vacate Ghaziabad Home, They Get Him Killed
content: Five days after a retired Indian Air Force (IAF) personnel was gunned down, police on Thursday claimed that the murder was orchestrated by the man's sons, who hired contract killers, including a Uttar Pradesh cop.

title: 'He Has Turned To God': Fake Video Shows Javed Akhtar In 'Topi', He Reacts
content: He wrote, "A fake video is in circulation showing my fake computer generated picture with a topi on my head claiming that ultimately I have turned to God. It is rubbish".

title: "We Added Water To Packaged Milk": Indore Family Loses 5-Month-Old
content: "God gave us happiness after ten years... and then God took it away," murmuring this repeatedly, an elderly woman weeps quietly in a narrow lane of Indore's Bhagirathpura.

title: "Mullahs Must Leave": Why Anti-Khamenei Protests Have Erupted In Iran
content: At least seven people have been reportedly killed in Iran as protesters and security forces clashed in several cities during demonstrations in the Islamic Republic's rural provinces over the ailing economy and rising cost of living.

title: Man Dies, 11 Hospitalised After New Year's Party In Hyderabad, Probe On
content: New Year celebrations in Hyderabad ended up in the hospital after a 53-year-old man died and over a dozen people fell ill. The police are investigating a spurious liquor angle and possible food poisoning.

title: Indian Student Killed In Germany On New Year, Was Trying To Escape Fire
content: Hruthik Reddy's family had been eagerly awaiting his homecoming for Sankranti. Now it is the body of the student from Telangana that will arrive in the new year. The 25-year-old student died in a fire accident in Germany late Wednesday night.

title: "Give Land Rights To Workers Or...": Assam Government Warns Tea Estates
content: During the winter session of the Assembly in November, the state government brought a legislation, 'Assam Fixation of Ceiling on Land Holding (Amendment) Bill, 2025, to distribute land in tea estates' labour lines among workers for housing ownership.

title: 1 Killed As Supporters Of Congress Leader, Another MLA Clash In Karnataka
content: Tensions are high in Karnataka's Ballari district after a man was killed in a clash that broke out when Congress workers tried to put a banner ahead of a Valmiki statue unveiling event scheduled tomorrow.

title: 4 Gurugram Cops Ram Vehicle On VIP Duty On New Year, Suspended
content: Four policemen, including an assistant sub-inspector of Gurugram police, were suspended on Thursday after their car rammed into a pilot vehicle on VIP duty on New Year's eve, police said.

title: BJP Drops Pune Candidate After Old Clips Show Her Slamming Devendra Fadnavis
content: The BJP withdrew the candidature of Pooja More-Jadhav in the Pune civic polls after a backlash from party workers.

title: KCR Deserves "Hanging" For River Water "Injustice": Revanth Reddy
content: Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy said it would not be wrong even if his predecessor K Chandrasekhar Rao and his nephew T Harish Rao were "hanged" for the injustice caused in utilisation of river waters.

title: Chinese War Games Around Taiwan "Unnecessarily" Raised Tensions: US
content: Chinese war games around Taiwan "unnecessarily" spiked tensions in the region, the US State Department said Thursday, calling on Beijing to "cease its military pressure."

title: 9,500 Years Ago, Stone Age Hunter-Gatherers Built Funeral Pyre In Africa
content: A scientific paper, published in the journal Science Advances, describes a spectacular event that happened about 9,500 years ago in Malawi in south-central Africa, challenging long-held notions about how hunter-gatherers treat their dead.

title: 7 Killed In Iran Protests Over Economy As Inflation Hits 42%
content: Widening demonstrations sparked by Iran's ailing economy spread Thursday into the Islamic Republic's rural provinces, with at least seven people being killed in the first fatalities reported among security forces and protesters, authorities said.

title: UP Doctor Rapes Nursing Student On False Marriage Promise, Case Filed
content: Police have booked an intern doctor of a government medical institute here for allegedly raping a nursing student on the false promise of marriage and threatening to make her private photos public.

title: New York Mayor Mamdani Pledges Left-Wing Success After Taking Office
content: Zohran Mamdani promised Thursday to show left-wing politics can succeed as he took over as New York mayor for a term sure to see him cross swords with US President Donald Trump.

title: Kim Jong Un's Daughter Makes 1st Public Visit To State Mausoleum
content: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un's daughter, Ju Ae, who is likely being prepared as his successor, accompanied her parents on her first public visit to the Kumsusan mausoleum to pay respects to former leaders, state media photos published showed.

title: Brazil's Bolsonaro Leaves Hospital After Surgeries, Returns To Prison
content: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro was discharged from hospital on Thursday after undergoing medical procedures to treat a hernia and hiccups, according to a Reuters witness and local media reports.

title: ‚ÄòNo way out‚Äô: Telangana student dies in Germany after jumping from burning apartment on New Year‚Äôs Eve
content: A 22-year-old Telangana engineering student, Thokala Hruthik Reddy, tragically died in Germany after jumping from his burning apartment on New Year's Eve. Trapped by a fire in Brandenburg, he suffered fatal head injuries. His family is now appealing for assistance to bring his body back to India.

title: Indore tragedy: Lab report confirms bacterial 'contamination' in water behind 4 diarrhoea deaths
content: Diarrhoea outbreak in Indore, claiming four lives and sickening over 1,400, has been traced to contaminated drinking water. Officials confirmed a leak in a main supply pipeline in Bhagirathpura, the epicentre, likely due to sewage mixing. Investigations are ongoing to identify the specific bacteria, with relief measures and compensation announced.

title: 'Unaffected by strike calls': Zomato, Swiggy log record orders on New Year's Eve
content: Food delivery giants Zomato and Swiggy experienced record-breaking New Year's Eve orders, largely unaffected by a gig worker strike. Despite calls for better pay, platforms reported millions of deliveries, highlighting food delivery's integral role in Indian celebrations. Popular choices included biryani, pizza, and traditional desserts, with dining out also seeing significant traction.

title: ‚ÄòReality check‚Äô: BJP cites Karnataka govt survey to slam Rahul; ridicules ‚Äòvote chori‚Äô charge
content: A Karnataka government study found most citizens believe elections are fair and EVMs deliver accurate results, countering Rahul Gandhi's 'vote chori' allegations. The survey, covering over 5,000 respondents, revealed strong public trust in the electoral process, with high agreement on free and fair elections and EVM reliability across all divisions, despite concerns about money's influence.

title: Microsoft at 50: Nadella‚Äôs big reshuffle; New CEO named to focus on company's biggest biz
content: Microsoft, celebrating its 50th anniversary, has undergone a significant leadership shakeup. CEO Satya Nadella is now focusing on AI, with Judson Althoff taking over as CEO of its commercial business. This restructuring aims to drive growth and innovation, allowing Nadella to concentrate on cutting-edge technical work, including AI advancements and datacenter expansion.

title: 'Cease military pressure': US reacts to China's drills around Taiwan; calls for restraint
content: The United States expressed concern over China's recent military exercises near Taiwan, stating they unnecessarily increase tensions. Urging Beijing to exercise restraint and engage in dialogue, the US reiterated its support for peace and stability across the Taiwan Strait, opposing unilateral changes to the status quo by force. Several other nations also voiced serious concerns regarding the drills.

title: Wellness in 2025: Why consistency beat crash-diets and 5 am guilt
content: In 2025, Indians shifted their health priorities beyond resolutions, focusing on personal transformation and mental well-being. While consistency remained a challenge, driven by busy schedules, people embraced flexible routines and the power of habit over motivation. This year redefined health as a human, ongoing journey rather than a perfect destination.

title: AI 'regrets' after pilot found drunk on Vancouver‚ÄìDelhi flight; initiates probe
content: An Air India pilot was found to be under the influence of alcohol by Canadian authorities before operating flight AI186 from Vancouver to Delhi on December 23. The cockpit crew member was offloaded, causing a flight delay. Air India is cooperating with local authorities and has taken the pilot off flying duties pending an investigation.

title: Neuralink and parenting: Meta AI chief Alexandr Wang on kids; will wait until Neuralink advances
content: Meta's AI chief, Alexandr Wang, revealed he'll delay having children until advanced brain-computer interfaces like Neuralink are widely available. He believes young children's brains are highly adaptable, allowing for intuitive integration of these technologies, potentially making future generations cognitively competitive with superintelligence.

title: ‚ÄòFound debris‚Äô:Russia shares ‚Äòevidence‚Äô of drone attack on Putin‚Äôs residence
content: Russia claims it shared evidence with the US linking Ukraine to a drone attack on President Putin's residence. Moscow presented drone debris and navigation system data, alleging the target was the presidential complex. Kyiv denies involvement, calling it a fabrication to justify further attacks. World leaders expressed concern, urging diplomatic solutions.

title: Delhi air pollution crisis: AQI in 'very poor' zone at 311; cold wave conditions to persist
content: Delhi's air quality plunged into the 'very poor' category with an AQI of 311 on Friday, exacerbated by chilly winter conditions. Pollutants are expected to linger due to low wind speeds and falling temperatures, with cold wave conditions forecast from January 2-5.

title: PPC 2026 goes viral as over three cr students rush to interact with PM Modi before Jan 11 deadline
content: Pariksha Pe Charcha PPC 2026 has gone viral as over three crore students, teachers, and parents register to interact with PM Modi. The programme, aimed at reducing exam-related stress, is open to students from Classes 6 to 12, teachers, and parents. Registrations close on January 11, 2026. Selected participants can win PPC kits, and ten ‚ÄòLegendary Exam Warriors‚Äô will receive golden tickets to meet the Prime Minister in person.

title: Tesla's former AI boss: Google Waymo cannot match Tesla self driving tech; explains the reason
content: Former Tesla AI director Andrej Karpathy believes Waymo cannot replicate Tesla's coast-to-coast autonomous drive due to its modular system versus Tesla's end-to-end neural network. Karpathy praised the milestone, despite recent criticism from Elon Musk about his "dated" understanding of Tesla's AI advancements.

title: 'So many lessons, memories': Shubman Gill looks back at a defining 2025 | Watch
content: Shubman Gill reflected on a momentous 2025, a year of sharp contrasts. Despite being dropped from the T20I setup, he achieved extraordinary red-ball success in England, piling up 754 runs. Gill also captained India to a memorable 2-2 draw in the Test series and played a key role in their Champions Trophy triumph.

title: Virat-Anushka are all smiles as they pose with hotel staff- Pics
content: Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma kicked off 2026 with a Dubai getaway, delighting fans with recent photos. The couple, known for their privacy, were seen smiling with hotel staff during a casual outing. Earlier, they celebrated New Year's with playful face paint and later a glamorous party, showcasing their versatile style.

title: 'We're thinking of you': New York mayor Zohran Mamdani writes to Umar Khalid
content: New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani sent a handwritten note to student activist Umar Khalid, currently jailed for nearly five years in connection with the 2020 Delhi riots. Mamdani expressed solidarity, stating, "we are all thinking of you" and recalling Khalid's words on avoiding bitterness. Khalid denies the charges against him.

title: Fans hail Ayesha Curry‚Äôs 'A+ wife move' as gesture for Stephen Curry goes viral
content: Ayesha Curry recently garnered widespread praise from fans for wearing her husband Stephen Curry's Davidson jersey during a visit to his alma mater. This heartwarming gesture, seen during a tribute to the NBA star, effectively silenced recent marriage rumors. Fans lauded her unwavering support and loyalty, highlighting the couple's strong bond.

title: Caitlin Clark & Connor McCaffery 2025 net worth: Earnings & endorsements
content: Caitlin Clark and Connor McCaffery, a power couple in the sports world, boast a combined net worth of $11.5 million. Clark, a WNBA star, has secured lucrative endorsements alongside her rookie contract. McCaffery, a rising basketball coach, is building his career after playing multiple sports in college. Their individual successes contribute to their impressive financial standing.

title: NHL trade rumours: Canucks linked to Sherwood, Pettersson; Bruins eye Maccelli
content: NHL trade buzz is intensifying as the Vancouver Canucks reportedly explore deals involving Kiefer Sherwood and Elias Pettersson. Meanwhile, the Boston Bruins are rumored to be eyeing Matias Maccelli to bolster their offense. With the March 6 trade deadline looming, these potential moves are capturing significant league attention, hinting at imminent roster changes for both franchises.

title: Khawaja retires: 'They told me I'd never play for Aus' ‚Äî Pak-born batter calls out stereotypes
content: Usman Khawaja announced his retirement from international cricket, confirming the upcoming fifth Ashes Test at the Sydney Cricket Ground will be his last. The veteran left-hander, Australia's first Muslim Test cricketer, reflected on a journey of resilience and representation, overcoming early career setbacks to become a key player and advocate.

title: Ex-IAF officer gunned down: Police say sons hired hitmen; key accused on the run
content: A former IAF officer was murdered near his Ghaziabad home by hired hitmen, including a police constable and a notorious juvenile offender. The sons of the victim, embroiled in a dispute over money and property, allegedly paid Rs 5 lakh for the assassination. The constable and the sons are currently absconding.

title: Mother‚Äôs unconventional way of teaching her son to sell Chikkis goes viral
content: A mother shared a viral video of her son selling chikki on the street, highlighting how mental barriers hinder children's learning. The initiative, which includes a free photo with each purchase, has garnered widespread appreciation and inspired others to share similar entrepreneurial experiences. The mother emphasized the importance of overcoming shyness to teach valuable life lessons.

title: Indore water contamination: Deathly silence in Bhagirathpura; toll rises to nine
content: A contaminated water supply in Indore's Bhagirathpura has led to a severe diarrhoea outbreak, claiming nine lives and hospitalizing over 200 residents. A leaking toilet waste pit near a water line is blamed for the contamination. Families are grappling with loss and illness, with one teacher losing her six-month-old son.

title: 'Year of Horse'- Vanessa Bryant's tribute to Chinese Zodiac in heartwarming post
content: Vanessa Bryant welcomed 2026 with her daughters in a heartwarming New Year's post. She embraced the "Year of the Horse" from the Chinese Zodiac. This symbolizes her commitment to strength, endurance, freedom, and independence for herself and her family. The post highlights her continued dedication to carrying Kobe Bryant's legacy forward.

title: 'SRK is a traitor': BJP targets KKR owner over picking Mustafizur Rahman
content: Hindu religious leaders and BJP figures have strongly criticized Bollywood actor Shah Rukh Khan. Their ire is directed at his IPL team, Kolkata Knight Riders, for selecting Bangladeshi cricketer Mustafizur Rahman. Congress has stepped in to defend Khan, labeling the criticism an attack on India's pluralism. The debate highlights differing views on nationalism and inclusion,

title: Damien Martyn hospitalised: 'Positive signs' ‚Äî Adam Gilchrist offers hopeful update
content: Former Australian cricketer Damien Martyn is showing positive signs of recovery after being hospitalised with meningitis and placed in an induced coma. Ex-teammate Adam Gilchrist shared the encouraging update, noting improvements over the past 24 hours. The cricketing world has rallied with immense support for the elegant batter, who remains in serious condition at Gold Coast University Hospital.

title: Watch: Stray dog picks a soft toy inside a store, strangers do something unexpected
content: A heartwarming video shows a stray dog in Mexico selecting a soft toy from a store shelf. When staff tried to retrieve it, customers intervened, purchasing the toy for the delighted canine. This act of kindness, shared widely online, has resonated with viewers, highlighting the power of simple compassion and reminding many that empathy thrives in everyday life.

title: Akshaye Khanna joins Telugu debut Mahakali sets
content: After making headlines for his controversial exit from Drishyam 3, Akshaye Khanna has now shifted focus to his upcoming mythological epic Mahakali. The actor, who is currently riding high on the success of his spy actioner Dhurandhar, has joined the sets of the film, marking his official Telugu debut.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 26,150; BSE Sensex up around 100 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Friday. While Nifty50 was above 261,50, BSE Sensex was up around 100 points.

title: Monkey mayhem in Bahadurgarh: Elderly woman attacked, bitten multiple times; CCTV shocks town
content: An elderly woman was brutally attacked by a troop of six to seven monkeys in Bahadurgarh, Haryana, on December 26th. CCTV footage captured the startling assault as the primates pounced, biting and pulling the woman's hair while she sat on a chair. This alarming incident highlights growing concerns over monkey incursions into residential zones.

title: GATE 2026 admit card release postponed, IIT Guwahati to announce revised date soon at
content: The Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati has postponed the release of the GATE 2026 admit card, earlier expected on January 2, 2026. Candidates will be able to download the hall ticket from the GOAPS portal at gate2026.iitg.ac.in once the revised date is announced. The admit card is mandatory for entry to the examination hall. GATE 2026 will be held on February 7, 8, 14 and 15, 2026 across India in multiple shifts at designated centres.

title: Paulina Gretzky net worth 2025: Inside her wealth and career highlights
content: The daughter of a legendary hockey player, Wayne Gretzky, and a wife to a pro golf player, Dustin Johnson, Paulina Gretzky has established her own way in the industry of entertainment and social media. Having a net worth of five million dollars, she has been successful in business, modeling, and acting. It has also been reported that she will inherit a large portion of her father's fortune.

title: 'Dhurandhar' BO collection day 28: Ranveer Singh starrer ends week 4 with Rs 100 cr haul
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' has shattered box office records, becoming the highest-grossing Hindi film ever with a monumental Rs 1,136.75 crore worldwide. The spy thriller achieved a historic Rs 100 crore in its fourth week, outperforming new releases and setting new benchmarks for Bollywood. Its unprecedented run continues to dominate screens.

title: BJP‚Äôs big 2026 test: Defending the North, cracking the South
content: The BJP concluded 2025 with significant electoral victories, but 2026 presents a crucial test of its organizational strength and ideological reach. Facing assembly elections in West Bengal, Assam, Tamil Nadu, and Kerala, alongside local polls and Rajya Sabha contests, the party aims to expand its dominance. Success in these diverse arenas will shape its trajectory towards 2029.

title: Govt proposes 90-day work a year for gig workers to get social security
content: Gig and platform workers must be engaged for at least 90 days with an aggregator in a financial year to qualify for social security benefits under the new Social Security Code. This threshold increases to 120 days for workers engaged with multiple aggregators. The rules also outline registration requirements and the formation of a National Social Security Board.

title: ‚ÄòWherever, whenever they want‚Äô: Maduro says Venezuela open to dialogue with US
content: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro expressed openness to dialogue with Washington on drug trafficking, oil, and migration. However, he remained non-committal regarding US President Donald Trump's claims of a strike on a Venezuelan dock used by alleged drug boats. The US has not provided evidence for its recent maritime and potential land strikes against drug operations

title: Richest YouTubers 2025: Top 10 creators by net worth estimates
content: YouTube's biggest stars are now formidable business moguls, as evidenced by 2025's viral net worth rankings.  These creators have transcended simple video uploads, building empires through brands, merchandise, and ventures.  MrBeast leads the pack with an estimated $1 billion, showcasing the immense wealth generated by digital talent reshaping global entertainment.

title: 'Play like Pujara and Rahane': Ex-India batter's old-school advice amid Test batting chaos
content: Former India batter Robin Uthappa critiques the MCG Test pitch as seam-friendly but not unplayable, attributing struggles to modern batting's lack of patience. He argues for a reset in expectations, suggesting 250 can be competitive with discipline, citing Pujara and Rahane as examples. Uthappa also lamented Joe Root's struggles, reflecting a broader concern about Test cricket's entertainment over endurance.

title: ‚ÄòNot an accident, but road rage‚Äô: Friend says SUV chased, mowed down 2 youths after tiff in Noida
content: Two youths were killed in Noida after their bike was allegedly rammed by an SUV following an altercation at an eatery. A friend claims the incident was not an accident but a deliberate act of road rage. Police are investigating, scanning CCTV footage to identify the vehicle, which reportedly lacked a number plate.

title: 'Pushed Bangladesh towards darkness': Sheikh Hasina takes aim at Muhammad Yunus
content: Former Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina accused the interim government of plunging the country into darkness through corruption and falsehood. Her party, Awami League, highlighted the emboldening of extremist groups and the targeting of minority communities, particularly Christians, who are being branded as "political enemies" and "enemies of Islam."

title: 'This is how greatness is built': Pathan backs Gill to follow Kohli's path
content: Irfan Pathan drew parallels between his own early international career under Rahul Dravid and Shubman Gill's current trajectory. Pathan believes Gill's leadership roles have fostered significant growth, mirroring the lessons he received about handling increased pressure. Despite a T20 setback, Pathan sees Gill's talent and willingness to learn as indicators of future success.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for January 2 ‚Äî check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research recommends Canara Bank, and Nykaa as the top stock picks for January 2, 2026. It also shares its views on Nifty and Bank Nifty.

title: 'Act by Jan 26': Canada asks Air India for action against 'tipsy' pilot
content: Air India faces scrutiny from Transport Canada after a pilot was found intoxicated before operating a flight from Vancouver on December 23, 2025. Canadian authorities reported the pilot failed a breathalyser test, leading to his removal from duty. Air India is investigating and has informed the DGCA, with potential enforcement action expected.

title: 'Mandir-masjid' issues do not sway elections: Dilip Ghosh
content: Former Bengal BJP chief Dilip Ghosh questioned the electoral impact of "mandir-masjid politics" and criticized "recent entrants" to the state unit. Ghosh, who met Union minister Amit Shah, also expressed his desire to contest his home seat in the 2026 assembly polls and spoke of being sidelined.

title: Bengal SIR: EC warns of action if voters aged 85 and above called for hearings
content: Strict action awaits Booth Level Officers (BLOs) and their supervisors if elderly, sick, or disabled voters are summoned for hearings. Despite prior instructions, reports indicate these vulnerable individuals, including pregnant women, were still asked to appear. The Election Commission now mandates home verification for such electors, aiming to prevent distress and uphold its image.

content: the playoffs will begin Saturday, Jan. 10 with the first two wild-card round games . there are two open spots (one in each conference), uncertainty for both the AFC and NFC 1-seeds and a few division titles out there for the taking . we won't know the complete playoff bracket until late Sunday night .

title: Which NBA star had the best year? The 2025 Golden Basketball goes to ...
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder are 1-2 again in the first installment of the MVP straw poll conducted by ESPN's Tim Bontemps . Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and Nikola Jokic of the Denver Nuggets battled for MVP of the 2024-25 regular season .

title: Ranking the best players in the college football transfer portal
content: the offseason transfer portal window for college football players opens at midnight on Jan. 2 and extends through Jan. 16 . there's no spring transfer period this year, so teams have one big chance to get their rosters right for 2026 . sportsmail's rankings of the top players in the portal .

title: College football transfer portal: Tracking who's on the move
content: College football's transfer portal officially opens at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. Once the portal opens, players have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.
